Irisbond Duo API
  • notitle
  • Starting the API
High performance mode

When the Irisbond Duo is on, the CPU idle states are disabled to ensure good tracking quality and an optimal user experience. The tracker is said to run in high performance mode.

A known drawback of working in high performance mode is that the battery life is reduced. To avoid this problem, the API allows to switch between high and low performance mode, once the API is running.

Working in low performance mode may be risky on some CPUs, and the camera might not work properly, having the user a bad experience. Running in low performance mode should be done on very specific and well-known CPUs, and the application should have an option for the user to go back to high performance mode again.

Disabling high performance mode can be done by running:

IrisbondDuo.setHighPerformanceMode(false);

And checking the performance mode can be done by running:

bool highPerformanceMode = IrisbondDuo.isHighPerformanceMode();
